GLOSS_IN_SOURCE: to burn, be on fire (by itself)
1. to open (e.g. the door) 2. to wear clothes with a zipper or buttons in an open fashion
to feel shy (e.g. in front of prominent people of high social status)
to cut, to be sharp enough to cut (tools with blades)
to burn (primarily used for oil and gasoline only; e.g. a car, but also human subjects)
to come (reference point outside the ego)
to be many (of wild animals, daemons, and ogres)
to cut (by pressing against a   blade)
to cut into pieces (meat), to cut cloth

CONCEPT: to marry (a man marries a woman)
